module.name: laz2_XMLWrite
module.short: Provides routines used to write XML content to a file, text file, or stream

descr.p: laz2_xmlwrite.pas provides procedures and types used to write XML content to a file, text file, or stream. laz2_xmlwrite.pas has classes in its implementation section that are used to perform serialization of XML content to the storage destination.

element.name: TXMLWriterFlag
element.short: Represent options enabled when writing XML content
element.descr: TXMLWriterFlag is an enumerated type with values that represent options enabled when writing XML content. Values in TXMLWriterFlag are stored in the TXMLWriterFlags set type, and passed as an argument to the WriteXMLFile and WriteXML routines.

element.name: TXMLWriterFlag.xwfSpecialCharsInAttributeValue
element.short: Enables writing Carriage Return (Decimal 13) characters in attribute values instead of the numeric character entity &xD;

element.name: TXMLWriterFlag.xwfPreserveWhiteSpace
element.short: Preserves whitespace in DOM Text nodes

element.name: TXMLWriterFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TXMLWriterFlag values

descr.p: TXMLWriterFlags is a set type used to store 0 or more values from the TXMLWriterFlag enumeration. TXMLWriterFlags indicates the options enabled when writing XML content. TXMLWriterFlags is the type passed as an argument to the WriteXMLFile procedure.

element.name: WriteXMLFile
element.short: Writes an XML document to a file, text file, or stream

descr.p: WriteXMLFile is an overloaded procedure used to write an XML document to a file, text file, or stream. Overloaded variants provide the implementation details for each of the destinations, and create either TTextXMLWriter or TStreamXMLWriter class instances to store the XML document.

AFileName indicates the file name on the local file system where the XML content is stored. AFileName can contain UTF-8 encoded values, and must represent a valid file name. If the file in AFileName already exists, an exception will be raised.

Flags contains values from the TXMLWriterFlag enumeration. Use Flags to enable XML writing options in the routine. The default value for the argument is an empty set ([]), and indicates that no options are enabled in the routine.

element.name: WriteXMLFile.doc
element.short: XML document written in the routine

element.name: WriteXMLFile.AFileName
element.short: File name where the XML content is stored

element.name: WriteXMLFile.AFile
element.short: Text file type where the content is written

element.name: WriteXMLFile.AStream
element.short: Stream where the XML document is stored

element.name: WriteXMLFile.Flags
element.short: Options enabled when writing the XML content

element.name: WriteXML
element.short: Writes a DOM Node to a file, text file, or stream

descr.p: WriteXML is an overloaded procedure used to write a DOM Node to a file, text file, or stream. WriteXML calls one of the overloaded WriteXMLFile routines for a specific destination.

Element is a TDOMNode parameter that represents the DOM Document Node with the XML content written in the method. WriteXML ensures that Element is cast to a TXMLDocument type when calling the WriteXMLFile routine.

AFileName indicates the file name on the local file system where the XML content is stored. AFileName can contain UTF-8 encoded values, and must represent a valid file name. If the file in AFileName already exists, an exception will be raised.

Flags contains values from the TXMLWriterFlag enumeration. Use Flags to enable XML writing options in the routine. The default value for the argument is an empty set ([]), and indicates that no options are enabled in the routine.

element.name: WriteXML.Element
element.short: DOM Node with the XML content written in the method

element.name: WriteXML.AFileName
element.short: File name where the XML content is stored

element.name: WriteXML.AFile
element.short: Text file type where the content is written

element.name: WriteXML.AStream
element.short: Stream where the XML document is stored

element.name: WriteXML.Flags
element.short: Options enabled when writing the XML content
